meanings.definition: A person who loiters, especially in a public place.
meanings.sent1: The group of loiterers outside the store made the customers uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The police warned the loiterers to move along from the park.
meanings.sent3: The loiterers outside the library were like statues frozen in time.
meanings.sent4: The city streets at night seemed to be haunted by the shadows of loiterers.
meanings.sent5: The loiterers in the alley whispered secrets to the passing wind.

meanings.definition: To stand or wait around without apparent purpose.
meanings.sent1: She noticed a few teenagers loitering near the bus stop after school.
meanings.sent2: The security guard asked the man to stop loitering in front of the building.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to loiter around the food bowl, hoping for a treat.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to loiter lazily on the hot summer afternoon.
meanings.sent5: The memories of childhood loitered in the back of her mind.
